meanings.definition: The position or role of a foreman.
meanings.sent1: His foremanship at the construction site ensured the project ran smoothly.
meanings.sent2: She was promoted to foremanship after years of hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's foremanship of the nut-gathering team was commendable.
meanings.sent4: Her foremanship was like a guiding light in the dark forest of tasks.
meanings.sent5: The foremanship of the captain kept the ship sailing steadily through rough waters.

meanings.definition: The skill or ability to lead a group of workers as a foreman.
meanings.sent1: His foremanship in managing the team was evident in the high productivity.
meanings.sent2: Effective foremanship requires clear communication and problem-solving skills.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's foremanship in organizing the fish-catching group was impressive.
meanings.sent4: Her foremanship was a beacon of guidance amidst the chaos of the workplace.
meanings.sent5: The foremanship of the coach motivated the team to achieve victory.
